field.name: summary
field.value: Colorizer goes crazy sometimes when editing

field.name: description
field.value:
I could reproduce it 90% of the time using the following procedure: - open an existing file; - edit the closing tag of an element that have a sibling, like: 1 2
...
3 4 5
...
6 ... If you position the cursor at the end of line 3 and press backspace, the lines 4 to the end of the file get messy. That's ok, the syntax is not valid anymore. But when you put the closing sign again ">", the problem persists. I tried to use Ctrl-A, as suggested in another issue to force the parser to rescan the file, but it haven't worked. After I get the syntax fixed (typing back the ">"), if I go to the start of the line 4 (the first line with buggy syntax highlighting), type in ## (NVelocity line comment) and then press backspace twice (to remove the comment), the whole file gets the correct syntax again. As an emergency option, I suggest you supply a command that can be used to completely reset the parser. So I can assign it to a keystroke (such as Ctrl-Alt-Backspace) and press whenever the parser get crazy again.
